How can I disconnect from a specific node using the Verus CLI?

You can disconnect from a specific node using the `disconnectnode` command, followed by the node's address as a string argument. For example:
```
verus disconnectnode "192.168.0.6:8233"
```
This will immediately disconnect from the specified node.

disconnectnode "node"

Immediately disconnects from the specified node.

Arguments:
1. "node"   (string, required) The node (see getpeerinfo for nodes)

Examples:
> verus disconnectnode "192.168.0.6:8233"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "disconnectnode", "params": ["192.168.0.6:8233"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the purpose of the `disconnectnode` command in Verus?
The `disconnectnode` command is used to immediately disconnect from a specific node in the Verus network. This can be useful for managing node connections and troubleshooting network issues.

disconnectnode "node"

Immediately disconnects from the specified node.

Arguments:
1. "node"   (string, required) The node (see getpeerinfo for nodes)

Examples:
> verus disconnectnode "192.168.0.6:8233"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "disconnectnode", "params": ["192.168.0.6:8233"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
Can I use the `disconnectnode` command with a JSON-RPC request?

Yes, you can use the `disconnectnode` command with a JSON-RPC request. For example:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "disconnectnode", "params": ["192.168.0.6:8233"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
This will send a JSON-RPC request to disconnect from the specified node.

disconnectnode "node"

Immediately disconnects from the specified node.

Arguments:
1. "node"   (string, required) The node (see getpeerinfo for nodes)

Examples:
> verus disconnectnode "192.168.0.6:8233"
> curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "disconnectnode", "params": ["192.168.0.6:8233"] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
